```diff
+ /**
+  * Header layout root component. Main container for header content.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutRootProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"header"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutRoot = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutRootProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;header
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.root, ui.bgSubtle, ui.text, style)}
+     /&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout section component. Generic container for header content with max-width, margin, and padding.
+  * Automatically adds a dim bottom border.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutSectionProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutSection = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutSectionProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.headerSection, style)} /&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout logo component. Displays a logo or branding in the header.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutLogoProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutLogo = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutLogoProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.logo, style)}&gt;
+       {children}
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout navigation component. Container for navigation links.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutNavProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"nav"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutNav = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutNavProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;nav
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.nav, style)}
+       aria-label="Main navigation"
+     &gt;
+       {children}
+     &lt;/nav&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout actions component. Container for action buttons or items (typically on the right side).
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutActionsProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutActions = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutActionsProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.actions, style)}&gt;{children}&lt;/div&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout search component. Container for search functionality.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutSearchProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutSearch = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutSearchProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.search, style)}&gt;{children}&lt;/div&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout divider component. Horizontal divider line for separating header sections.
+  */
+ export interface HeaderLayoutDividerProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"hr"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const HeaderLayoutDivider = ({
+   style,
+   ...props
+ }: HeaderLayoutDividerProps) =&gt; {
+   return &lt;hr {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.divider, style)} /&gt;;
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Header layout component with subcomponents.
+  */
+ export const HeaderLayout = {
+   Root: HeaderLayoutRoot,
+   Section: HeaderLayoutSection,
+   Logo: HeaderLayoutLogo,
+   Nav: HeaderLayoutNav,
+   Actions: HeaderLayoutActions,
+   Search: HeaderLayoutSearch,
+   Divider: HeaderLayoutDivider,
+ };
+
```

Created a new header layout component with slot-based subcomponents. Here's what was added:

## Created Files

1. **`packages/hip-ui/src/components/header-layout/index.tsx`** - Main component file with:
   - `HeaderLayoutRoot` - Main container
   - `HeaderLayoutSection` - Content section with max-width and padding
   - `HeaderLayoutLogo` - Logo/branding slot
   - `HeaderLayoutNav` - Navigation links container
   - `HeaderLayoutActions` - Action buttons/items container (typically right side)
   - `HeaderLayoutSearch` - Search functionality container
   - `HeaderLayoutDivider` - Horizontal divider for separating sections

2. **`packages/hip-ui/src/components/header-layout/header-layout-config.ts`** - Component configuration file

3. **Updated `packages/hip-ui/src/cli/install.tsx`** - Registered the component in the install system

## Features

- Slot-based architecture: subcomponents act as slots for flexible composition
- Responsive design: adapts from column to row layout on larger screens
- Theme integration: uses spacing, colors, and typography tokens
- TypeScript: all props interfaces documented with JSDoc
- Exports: both individual components and a namespace object (`HeaderLayout.Root`, etc.)

The component follows the same pattern as the Footer component and is ready to use. You can install it with `pnpm hip install header-layout` or use it directly in your codebase.

```diff
+ ---
+ title: HeaderLayout
+ description: A flexible header layout component with slot-based subcomponents for building site headers.
+ ---
+
+ import { PropDocs } from '../../../lib/PropDocs'
+ import { Example } from '../../../lib/Example'
+ import { Basic } from '../../../examples/header-layout/basic'
+ import { WithSearch } from '../../../examples/header-layout/with-search'
+ import { WithActions } from '../../../examples/header-layout/with-actions'
+ import { Comprehensive } from '../../../examples/header-layout/comprehensive'
+
+ &lt;Example src={Comprehensive} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ## Installation
+
+ Run the following command to add the header layout component to your project.
+
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pnpm hip install header-layout
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+
+ ## Props
+
+ This is a custom component built for header layouts.
+
+ &lt;PropDocs components={["HeaderLayoutRoot", "HeaderLayoutSection", "HeaderLayoutLogo", "HeaderLayoutNav", "HeaderLayoutActions", "HeaderLayoutSearch", "HeaderLayoutDivider"]} /&gt;
+
+ ## Features
+
+ ### Basic
+
+ A simple header with logo and navigation.
+
+ &lt;Example src={Basic} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ### With Search
+
+ Add a search field to your header.
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithSearch} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ### With Actions
+
+ Add action buttons to your header.
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithActions} noPadding /&gt;
+
+ ## Related Components
+
+ - [Link](/docs/components/link) - For navigation links in header
+ - [Button](/docs/components/button) - For action buttons in header
+ - [Navbar](/docs/components/navbar) - For more complex navigation needs
+ - [Footer](/docs/components/footer) - For site footer layouts
+ - [Flex](/docs/components/flex) - For flexible header layouts
+
```

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,42 @@
-
+ import { HeaderLayout } from "@/components/header-layout";
+ import { Link } from "@/components/link";
+ import { spacing } from "../../components/theme/spacing.stylex";
+ import * as stylex from "@stylexjs/stylex";
+
+ const styles = stylex.create({
+   header: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["8"],
+   },
+ });
+
+ function Logo() {
+   return (
+     &lt;svg
+       width="32"
+       height="32"
+       viewBox="0 0 120 120"
+       fill="currentColor"
+       xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
+     &gt;
+       &lt;circle cx="60" cy="60" r="50" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth="2" /&gt;
+     &lt;/svg&gt;
+   );
+ }
+
+ export function Basic() {
+   return (
```

## Completed steps

### 1. Documentation (MDX file)

Created `/apps/docs/src/docs/components/navigation/header-layout.mdx` with:

- Component description
- Installation instructions

- Feature examples

Created 4 example files in `/apps/docs/src/examples/header-layout/`:

- `basic.tsx` - Simple header with logo and navigation
- `with-search.tsx` - Header with search functionality
- `with-actions.tsx` - Header with action buttons
- `comprehensive.tsx` - Full-featured header with all slots

All examples follow the codebase patterns:

- Use `@/components` imports
- Use StyleX for styling
- Use theme tokens (spacing, etc.)
- Include a simple logo component

---

Restructured the header-layout component into unstyled slots. Summary:

## Updated Component Structure

The component now provides four unstyled slots:

1. **`HeaderLayout.Root`** - Main container (div)
2. **`HeaderLayout.Header`** - Header slot (header element)
3. **`HeaderLayout.Page`** - Page content slot (main element)
4. **`HeaderLayout.Footer`** - Footer slot (footer element)

## Changes Made

1. **Component implementation** - Removed all styling; components are pure slots that pass through the `style` prop
2. **Config file** - Updated to only include the types dependency (no theme dependencies needed)
3. **Documentation** - Updated to reflect the new slot-based structure
4. **Examples** - Created new examples showing:
   - `basic.tsx` - Simple header + page layout
   - `with-footer.tsx` - Header + page + footer layout
   - `styled.tsx` - Shows how to style the slots yourself

The components are now unstyled slots you can fill with any content and style as needed. They use semantic HTML elements (`header`, `main`, `footer`) and pass through StyleX styles via the `style` prop.

Moved the styles from the example into the HeaderLayout component implementation. Changes:

## Changes Made

1. **Component Implementation** - Added default styles to all HeaderLayout components:
   - `Root`: Full viewport height, flex column layout, background color
   - `Header`: Flex shrink to prevent compression
   - `Page`: Flex grow, padding, max-width with centering
   - `Footer`: Flex shrink to prevent compression

2. **Config File** - Updated to include theme dependencies:
   - `spacing.stylex.tsx` for padding
   - `color.stylex.tsx` for background color

3. **Examples** - Removed redundant styles from all examples since the component now has defaults:
   - `basic.tsx` - Now uses default styles
   - `with-footer.tsx` - Now uses default styles
   - `styled.tsx` - Now uses default styles (renamed to show it works out of the box)

The component now has default styles that work out of the box, but users can still override them using the `style` prop. The styles are applied first, then any custom styles passed via the prop are merged in.

---

## Changes Made

1. **Added Hero Component** - Created `HeaderLayoutHero` that:
   - Is a full-width section (`width: 100%`)
   - Has a primary color background (`primary.bg`)
   - Contains an inner div that constrains content to the max-width (`var(--page-content-max-width)`)
   - Uses responsive padding matching the page component

2. **Updated Config** - Added `semantic-color.stylex.tsx` and `media-queries.stylex.tsx` to dependencies

3. **Updated Documentation** - Added Hero to the props documentation and created a "With Hero" example

4. **Created Example** - Added `with-hero.tsx` showing the Hero component in use

The Hero component is now available as `HeaderLayout.Hero` and can be used anywhere in the layout. The section spans the full width with a primary background, while the inner content respects the same max-width constraint as the page content.

---
